headline: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Faces Hurdles: 'It's A Lot Of Market Share'
summary: President Donald Trump said Sunday night that the proposed Netflix-Warner Bros. deal could be a problem. "It’s a lot of market share."

content.title: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Faces Hurdles: 'It's A Lot Of Market Share'
content.summary: President Donald Trump said Sunday night that the proposed Netflix-Warner Bros. deal could be a problem. "It’s a lot of market share."

headline: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Deal ‘Could be a Problem’
summary: WASHINGTON—President Trump said  Netflix’s   $72 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. “could be a problem” because it would result in a large market share for the streaming giant, signaling possible government resistance in his first public comments about the sale.  “They have a very big market share,” Trump said Sunday night of Netflix.  “And when they have Warner Brothers, that share goes up a lot.”

content.title: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Deal ‘Could be a Problem’
content.summary: WASHINGTON—President Trump said  Netflix’s   $72 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. “could be a problem” because it would result in a large market share for the streaming giant, signaling possible government resistance in his first public comments about the sale.  “They have a very big market share,” Trump said Sunday night of Netflix.  “And when they have Warner Brothers, that share goes up a lot.”

headline: PARAMOUNT LAUNCHES All-CASH TENDER OFFER TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY FOR $30 PER SHARE
summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount"), today announced it has commenced an all-cash tender offer to acquire all of the outstanding shares of Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") for $30.00 per share in cash. Paramount's proposed transaction is for the entirety of WBD, including the Global Networks segment.

content.title: PARAMOUNT LAUNCHES All-CASH TENDER OFFER TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY FOR $30 PER SHARE
content.summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount"), today announced it has commenced an all-cash tender offer to acquire all of the outstanding shares of Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") for $30.00 per share in cash. Paramount's proposed transaction is for the entirety of WBD, including the Global Networks segment.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Jumps After Paramount Makes Bid
summary: Shares in Warner Bros. Discovery jumped after Paramount said it was launching an all-cash tender offer for the media company, attempting to derail a $72 billion deal with Netflix.  Warner Discovery shares rose more 7% in morning trading, to more than $28 a share.  Paramount is offering $30 a share.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Jumps After Paramount Makes Bid
content.summary: Shares in Warner Bros. Discovery jumped after Paramount said it was launching an all-cash tender offer for the media company, attempting to derail a $72 billion deal with Netflix.  Warner Discovery shares rose more 7% in morning trading, to more than $28 a share.  Paramount is offering $30 a share.

headline: Why Trump says Netflix–Warner Bros. deal could be a 'problem'
summary: Paramount Skydance (PSKY) offered an all-cash bid for Warner Bros. (WBD), countering WBD's recently announced deal with Netflix (NFLX). Paramount's offer comes after US President Trump told reporters that the Netflix deal could be a "problem" given the streaming giant's market share dominance. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to outline the details of Paramount's offer compared to Netflix's. Innovator Capital Management chief investment strategist Tim Urbanowicz discusses what the bidding war means for Netflix investors and consumer prices. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to outline the details of Paramount's offer compared to Netflix's. Innovator Capital Management chief investment strategist Tim Urbanowicz discusses what the bidding war means for Netflix investors and consumer prices.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Paramount Made a Hostile Bid for Warner After Netflix Deal. What Happens Next?
summary: Paramount on Monday made a $77.9 billion hostile takeover bid for  Warner Bros. Discovery  escalating its fight for the entertainment company against Netflix by bringing its case directly to Warner shareholders.  Netflix  on Friday agreed to buy Warner Bros. for $72 billion after Warner splits its studios and HBO Max streaming business from its cable networks.

content.title: Paramount Made a Hostile Bid for Warner After Netflix Deal. What Happens Next?
content.summary: Paramount on Monday made a $77.9 billion hostile takeover bid for  Warner Bros. Discovery  escalating its fight for the entertainment company against Netflix by bringing its case directly to Warner shareholders.  Netflix  on Friday agreed to buy Warner Bros. for $72 billion after Warner splits its studios and HBO Max streaming business from its cable networks.

headline: NFLX- Warner Buy Will Leave it With an $82.7 Billion Headache
summary: Netflix Inc. (NFLX) just bought an $82.7 billion headache. It dropped that much money to swallow Warner Bros. Studios and HBO Max through a buyout of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (WBD) — snapping up Harry Potter, Batman, Game of Thrones, and Casablanca like it was clearing out the bargain bin at a liquidation sale, suggests Keith Fitz-Gerald, editor of 5 With Fitz.

content.title: NFLX- Warner Buy Will Leave it With an $82.7 Billion Headache
content.summary: Netflix Inc. (NFLX) just bought an $82.7 billion headache. It dropped that much money to swallow Warner Bros. Studios and HBO Max through a buyout of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (WBD) — snapping up Harry Potter, Batman, Game of Thrones, and Casablanca like it was clearing out the bargain bin at a liquidation sale, suggests Keith Fitz-Gerald, editor of 5 With Fitz.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman outlines three stories trending during Monday's trading session. IBM (IBM) is set to buy Confluent (CFLT) in a $9.3 billion deal. Paramount Skydance (PSKY) announced an all-cash offer to buy Warner Bros. (WBD), countering the recently announced Netflix (NFLX) deal. Morgan Stanley analysts downgraded Tesla (TSLA). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Netflix Wins the Streaming Wars: The $82B Warner Bros. Deal
summary: Netflix cements its status as the global entertainment leader by acquiring the legendary Warner Bros studio and its vast library of iconic franchises.
